triples.name: Data synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL provides a core software-based approach to synchronizing data streams with time stamps and time synchronization across networks.

triples.name: Clock synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL relies on clock synchronization techniques to ensure accurate temporal alignment of multimodal data streams.

triples.name: Data acquisition
triples.relevance: LSL is designed to solve the data acquisition challenge of recording synchronized interactions from multiple independent instruments.

triples.name: Multimodal learning
triples.relevance: LSL enables the collection and synchronization of multimodal data from multiple instruments and sensors.

triples.name: Brain-computer interface
triples.relevance: LSL is widely used in brain-computer interface applications as a data synchronization platform for real-time neural recording and processing.

triples.name: Real-time computing
triples.relevance: LSL enables millisecond-precise, continuous data recording through real-time synchronization and jitter compensation.

triples.name: Neurophysiology
triples.relevance: LSL was built from the ground up for neurophysiological applications requiring synchronized recording of multiple data streams.

triples.name: Local area network
triples.relevance: LSL uses a local area network (LAN) infrastructure to synchronize data streams and account for network delays and jitters.

triples.name: Software framework
triples.relevance: LSL is a software framework providing a zero-configuration infrastructure for multimodal data synchronization across multiple programming languages.
